articles.description: Reaction to Thursday's European games, plus updates from Friday's Premier League news conferences.
articles.title: European reaction: All English sides win, draws for Scots

articles.description: An arrest warrant is issued for Buffalo Bills linebacker Von Miller in a domestic violence case involving a pregnant woman.
articles.title: Arrest warrant issued for Buffalo Bills' Miller

articles.description: Wales coach Warren Gatland believes Owen Farrell's decision to step away from international rugby should be a "wake-up call for all of us".
articles.title: Farrell decision a 'wake-up call' - Gatland

articles.description: Kenyan legend Eliud Kipchoge says Olympic 5,000m champion Joshua Cheptegei can break the marathon world record one day.
articles.title: Kipchoge tips Cheptegei to break marathon record

articles.description: Tiger Woods shoots a three-over-par 75 as he makes his return to competitive golf in the Hero World Challenge.
articles.title: 'Rusty' Woods shoots 75 on return from injury

articles.description: England forward Lauren Hemp says it would be "incredible" to win her 50th cap at Wembley Stadium in the Women's Nations League on Friday.
articles.title: Hemp eyes 50th cap in crucial Lionesses match

articles.description: With the Euro 2024 draw taking place on Saturday, manager Gareth Southgate has a lot to ponder as he looks to finally deliver silverware for England.
articles.title: Southgate's final fling? Will England win Euro 2024?

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on AEW wrestler Claudio Castagnoli for this weekend's Premier League predictions.
articles.title: Sutton's Premier League predictions v AEW wrestler Castagnoli

articles.description: Dak Prescott makes three touchdown passes to help the Dallas Cowboys complete a fourth-quarter comeback against the Seattle Seahawks.
articles.title: Prescott leads Cowboys to comeback win over Seahawks

articles.description: Police make 39 arrests after clashing with Legia Warsaw fans outside Aston Villa's stadium.
articles.title: Aston Villa: Four officers injured in clashes with Legia Warsaw fans
